chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Bruce RI Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $1,000.00 payable to Corey D.

- The Court ordered that all MANDATORY court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
- The Court WAIVED all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges due to indigency.

- Seek and maintain full-time employment if not in school.
- Obtain GED/HSED. No unexcused absences.

- The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    
- Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.
- Upon successful completion of probation, the Court will grant expungement.

- Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
- Other counseling needs to be determined.

- ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bruce RI Davis

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction; with credit for 2 DAYS served.  

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 30 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction STAYED pending agents review. 
The Court ordered that all MANDATORY court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
The Court WAIVED all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges due to indigency. 
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.
Seek and maintain full-time employment if not in school. 
Obtain GED/HSED. No unexcused absences. 
Perform 24 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization.
No contact with India B.
Other counseling needs to be determined.
Restitution in the amount of $1,000.00 payable to Corey D.
Upon successful completion of probation, the Court will grant expungement. 

The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.

FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Bruce RI Davis in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire and jury instruction received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint/Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record. 

The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   

Court ordered a presentence investigation with/without a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. 

Case proceeded to sentencing. 

FILED: Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights; Addendum to plea questionnaire and waiver of rights; Jury Instructions
filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Bruce RI Davis in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Jessica Bellows on behalf of Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing State request an adjournment as they are in Jury Trial on another matter. Parties are in negotiations.  Case adjourned, branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
The COURT WITHDRAW THE STAYED BENCH WARRANT AND ANY BAIL REINSTATED.
8:32 am Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Stayed a Bench Warrant to be issued.  ANY BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Defendant Bruce RI Davis in court with Attorney  Angel Johnson for Connor Romenesko.  Jessica Bellows for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court scheduling conference.  The scheduling conference was held in person.  The matter was scheduled for plea and sentencing hearing.  The Court adjourned the matter back to Branch 38.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report  received and filed

Defendant Bruce RI Davis in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for additional hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Sanders.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.

Defendant Bruce RI Davis in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Greenfield Officer R. Speich. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.   This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/ed5b9ae0-0153-fff4-9924-88d8db5a37c1  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
No driving during pendency of case.

Defendant Bruce RI Davis in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Bruce RI Davis in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bruce RI Davis appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
